Package.Name: MIGS.ba.human-associated.6.0
Package.Description: Use for cultured bacterial or archaeal genomic sequences. Organism must have lineage Bacteria or Archaea.
Package.TemplateHeader: # This is a submission template for batch deposit of 'MIGS: cultured bacteria/archaea, human-associated; version 6.0' samples to the NCBI BioSample database (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/). # See SAMN02839585 for an example record of this type of BioSample (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/SAMN02839585). # Fields with an asterisk (*) are mandatory. Your submission will fail if any mandatory fields are not completed. If information is unavailable for any mandatory field, please enter 'not collected', 'not applicable' or 'missing' as appropriate. # All other fields are optional. Leave optional fields empty if no information is available. # You can add any number of custom fields to fully describe your BioSamples, simply include them in the table. # CAUTION: Be aware that Excel may automatically apply formatting to your data. In particular, take care with dates, incrementing autofills and special characters like / or -. Doublecheck that your text file is accurate before uploading to BioSample. # TO MAKE A SUBMISSION: # 1. Complete the template table (typically in Excel, or another spreadsheet application) # 2. Save the worksheet as a Text (Tab-delimited) file - use 'File, Save as, Save as type: Text (Tab-delimited)' # 3. Upload the file on the 'Attributes' tab of the BioSample Submission Portal at https://submit.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/subs/biosample/. # 4. If you have any questions, please contact us at biosamplehelp@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov.

Attribute.Name: strain
Attribute.Description: microbial or eukaryotic strain name

Attribute.Name: collection date
Attribute.Description: the date on which the sample was collected; date/time ranges are supported by providing two dates from among the supported value formats, delimited by a forward-slash character; collection times are supported by adding "T", then the hour and minute after the date, and must be in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), otherwise known as "Zulu Time" (Z); supported formats include "DD-Mmm-YYYY", "Mmm-YYYY", "YYYY" or ISO 8601 standard "YYYY-mm-dd", "YYYY-mm", "YYYY-mm-ddThh:mm:ss"; e.g., 30-Oct-1990, Oct-1990, 1990, 1990-10-30, 1990-10, 21-Oct-1952/15-Feb-1953, 2015-10-11T17:53:03Z; valid non-ISO dates will be automatically transformed to ISO format

Attribute.Name: broad-scale environmental context
Attribute.Description: Add terms that identify the major environment type(s) where your sample was collected. Recommend subclasses of biome [ENVO:00000428]. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes e.g.: Â mangrove biome [ENVO:01000181]|estuarine biome [ENVO:01000020]

Attribute.Name: local-scale environmental context
Attribute.Description: Add terms that identify environmental entities having causal influences upon the entity at time of sampling, multiple terms can be separated by pipes, e.g.: Â shoreline [ENVO:00000486]|intertidal zone [ENVO:00000316]

Attribute.Name: environmental medium
Attribute.Description: Add terms that identify the material displaced by the entity at time of sampling. Recommend subclasses of environmental material [ENVO:00010483]. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes e.g.: estuarine water [ENVO:01000301]|estuarine mud [ENVO:00002160]

Attribute.Name: geographic location
Attribute.Description: Geographical origin of the sample; use the appropriate name from this list http://www.insdc.org/documents/country-qualifier-vocabulary. Use a colon to separate the country or ocean from more detailed information about the location, eg "Canada: Vancouver" or "Germany: halfway down Zugspitze, Alps"

Attribute.Name: host
Attribute.Description: The natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which the sample was obtained. Use the full taxonomic name, eg, "Homo sapiens".

Attribute.Name: isolation and growth condition
Attribute.Description: PMID or url for isolation and growth condition specifications

Attribute.Name: latitude and longitude
Attribute.Description: The geographical coordinates of the location where the sample was collected. Specify as degrees latitude and longitude in format "d[d.dddd] N|S d[dd.dddd] W|E", eg, 38.98 N 77.11 W

Attribute.Name: number of replicons
Attribute.Description: Number of replicons in nuclear genome

Attribute.Name: reference for biomaterial
Attribute.Description: Primary publication or genome report

Attribute.Name: amniotic fluid color
Attribute.Description: specification of the color of the amniotic fluid sample

Attribute.Name: observed biotic relationship
Attribute.Description: Free-living or from host (define relationship)

Attribute.Name: blood disorder
Attribute.Description: history of blood disorders; can include multiple disorders

Attribute.Name: chemical administration
Attribute.Description: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v1.72), please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/44603

Attribute.Name: collection method
Attribute.Description: Process used to collect the sample, e.g., bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL)

Attribute.Name: major diet change in last six months
Attribute.Description: specification of major diet changes in the last six months, if yes the change should be specified

Attribute.Name: drug usage
Attribute.Description: any drug used by subject and the frequency of usage; can include multiple drugs used

Attribute.Name: encoded traits
Attribute.Description: Traits like antibiotic resistance/xenobiotic degration phenotypes/converting phage genes

Attribute.Name: estimated size
Attribute.Description: Estimated size of genome

Attribute.Name: ethnicity
Attribute.Description: ethnicity of the subject

Attribute.Name: extrachromosomal elements
Attribute.Description: Plasmids that have significance phenotypic consequence

Attribute.Name: fetal health status
Attribute.Description: specification of foetal health status, should also include abortion

Attribute.Name: gestation state
Attribute.Description: specification of the gestation state

Attribute.Name: host age
Attribute.Description: Age of host at the time of sampling

Attribute.Name: host body mass index
Attribute.Description: body mass index of the host, calculated as weight/(height)squared

Attribute.Name: host body product
Attribute.Description: substance produced by the host, e.g. stool, mucus, where the sample was obtained from

Attribute.Name: host body temperature
Attribute.Description: core body temperature of the host when sample was collected

Attribute.Name: host diet
Attribute.Description: type of diet depending on the sample for animals omnivore, herbivore etc., for humans high-fat, meditteranean etc.; can include multiple diet types

Attribute.Name: host disease
Attribute.Description: Name of relevant disease, e.g. Salmonella gastroenteritis. Controlled vocabulary, http://bioportal.bioontology.org/ontologies/1009 or http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/mesh

Attribute.Name: host height
Attribute.Description: the height of subject

Attribute.Name: host HIV status
Attribute.Description: HIV status of subject, if yes HAART initiation status should also be indicated as [YES or NO]

Attribute.Name: host last meal
Attribute.Description: content of last meal and time since feeding; can include multiple values

Attribute.Name: host occupation
Attribute.Description: most frequent job performed by subject

Attribute.Name: host pulse
Attribute.Description: resting pulse of the host, measured as beats per minute

Attribute.Name: host sex
Attribute.Description: Gender or physical sex of the host

Format.Description: male | female | pooled male and female | neuter | hermaphrodite | intersex | not determined | missing | not applicable | not collected | not provided | restricted access

Attribute.Name: host subject id
Attribute.Description: a unique identifier by which each subject can be referred to, de-identified, e.g. #131

Attribute.Name: observed host symbionts
Attribute.Description: The taxonomic name of the organism(s) found living in mutualistic, commensalistic, or parasitic symbiosis with the specific host

Attribute.Name: host taxonomy ID
Attribute.Description: NCBI taxonomy ID of the host, e.g. 9606

Attribute.Name: host tissue sampled
Attribute.Description: name of body site where the sample was obtained from, such as a specific organ or tissue, e.g., tongue, lung. For foundational model of anatomy ontology (fma) (v 4.11.0) or Uber-anatomy ontology (UBERON) (v releases/2014-06-15) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/FMA or http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/UBERON

Attribute.Name: host total mass
Attribute.Description: total mass of the host at collection, the unit depends on host

Attribute.Name: medication code
Attribute.Description: can include multiple medication codes

Attribute.Name: isolation source
Attribute.Description: Describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample from which the sample was derived.

Attribute.Name: kidney disorder
Attribute.Description: history of kidney disorders; can include multiple disorders

Attribute.Name: maternal health status
Attribute.Description: specification of the maternal health status

Attribute.Name: medical history performed
Attribute.Description: whether full medical history was collected

Attribute.Name: miscellaneous parameter
Attribute.Description: any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

Attribute.Name: negative control type
Attribute.Description: The substance or equipment used as a negative control in an investigation, e.g., distilled water, phosphate buffer, empty collection device, empty collection tube, DNA-free PCR mix, sterile swab, sterile syringe

Attribute.Name: nose throat disorder
Attribute.Description: history of nose-throat disorders; can include multiple disorders

Attribute.Name: Omics Observatory ID
Attribute.Description: A unique identifier of the omics-enabled observatory (or comparable time series) your data derives from. This identifier should be provided by the OMICON ontology; if you require a new identifier for your time series, contact the ontology's developers. Information is available here:Â https://github.com/GLOMICON/omicon. This field is only applicable to records which derive from an omics time-series or observatory.

Attribute.Name: organism count
Attribute.Description: total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample,should include name of organism followed by count; can include multiple organism counts

Attribute.Name: oxygenation status of sample
Attribute.Description: oxygenation status of sample

Attribute.Name: pathogenicity
Attribute.Description: To what is the entity pathogenic

Attribute.Name: perturbation
Attribute.Description: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

Attribute.Name: presence of pets or farm animals
Attribute.Description: specification of presence of pets or farm animals in the environment of subject, if yes the animals should be specified; can include multiple animals present

Attribute.Name: positive control type
Attribute.Description: The substance, mixture, product, or apparatus used to verify that a process which is part of an investigation delivers a true positive

Attribute.Name: pulmonary disorder
Attribute.Description: history of pulmonary disorders; can include multiple disorders

Attribute.Name: relationship to oxygen
Attribute.Description: Is this organism an aerobe, anaerobe? Please note that aerobic and anaerobic are valid descriptors for microbial environments, eg, aerobe, anaerobe, facultative, microaerophilic, microanaerobe, obligate aerobe, obligate anaerobe, missing, not applicable, not collected, not provided, restricted access

Format.Description: aerobe | anaerobe | facultative | microaerophilic | microanaerobe | obligate aerobe | obligate anaerobe | missing | not applicable | not collected | not provided | restricted access

Attribute.Name: sample collection device or method
Attribute.Description: Method or device employed for collecting sample

Attribute.Name: sample material processing
Attribute.Description: Processing applied to the sample during or after isolation

Attribute.Name: sample size
Attribute.Description: Amount or size of sample (volume, mass or area) that was collected

Attribute.Name: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
Attribute.Description: volume (mL) or weight (g) of sample processed for DNA extraction

Attribute.Name: smoker
Attribute.Description: specification of smoking status

Attribute.Name: source material identifiers
Attribute.Description: unique identifier assigned to a material sample used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples.

Attribute.Name: study completion status
Attribute.Description: specification of study completion status, if no the reason should be specified

Attribute.Name: subspecific genetic lineage
Attribute.Description: Information about the genetic distinctness of the lineage (eg., biovar, serovar)

Attribute.Name: temperature
Attribute.Description: temperature of the sample at time of sampling

Attribute.Name: travel outside the country in last six months
Attribute.Description: specification of the countries travelled in the last six months; can include multiple travels

Attribute.Name: trophic level
Attribute.Description: Feeding position in food chain (eg., chemolithotroph)

Format.Description: autotroph | carboxydotroph | chemoautotroph | chemoheterotroph | chemolithoautotroph | chemolithotroph | chemoorganoheterotroph | chemoorganotroph | chemosynthetic | chemotroph | copiotroph | diazotroph | facultative | heterotroph | lithoautotroph | lithoheterotroph | lithotroph | methanotroph | methylotroph | mixotroph | obligate | chemoautolithotroph | oligotroph | organoheterotroph | organotroph | photoautotroph | photoheterotroph | photolithoautotroph | photolithotroph | photosynthetic | phototroph

Attribute.Name: twin sibling existence
Attribute.Description: specification of twin sibling presence

Attribute.Name: urine collection method
Attribute.Description: specification of urine collection method

Attribute.Name: urogenital tract disorder
Attribute.Description: history of urogenitaltract disorders; can include multiple disorders

Attribute.Name: weight loss in last three months
Attribute.Description: specification of weight loss in the last three months, if yes should be further specified to include amount of weight loss
